paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant Val30Met, including penetrance data and individual patient details.

patients.phenotype: Familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP) stage I, sensory-motor axonal polyneuropathy, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy

individual_records.phenotype_details: Progressive imbalance during walking, unintentional weight loss, sensory-motor axonal polyneuropathy, hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
individual_records.evidence_sentence: A 71-year-old man complained of 1-year history of progressive imbalance during walking associated with unintentional weight loss.

functional_data.summary: The Val30Met variant is associated with hereditary transthyretin amyloidosis, leading to amyloid fibril deposition.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is known to segregate with disease in families affected by ATTRv.
variants.additional_notes: The patient developed severe liver enzyme increase after inotersen treatment, which normalized after discontinuation.
key_quotes: TTR genetic test resulted positive for Val30Met mutation.
His baseline evaluation showed familial amyloid polyneuropathy (FAP) stage I.

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the TTR variant.
